meanings.definition: A planned series of events or activities.
meanings.sent1: The school has exciting programmes for the students to enjoy.
meanings.sent2: The city has a variety of cultural programmes throughout the year.
meanings.sent3: The programmes for the picnic got mixed up, and now we have a game before lunch!
meanings.sent4: Her life seemed like a well-organized programme, each day carefully planned out.
meanings.sent5: The programmes at the amusement park made it a fun-filled day for everyone.

meanings.definition: A set of coded instructions for a computer.
meanings.sent1: The software engineer wrote complex programmes to automate tasks.
meanings.sent2: The computer science students were learning how to create programmes for different applications.
meanings.sent3: When the programmer made a mistake, the programme kept crashing!
meanings.sent4: His mind worked like a series of interconnected programmes, processing information quickly.
meanings.sent5: The efficiency of the new programme saved the company time and money.

meanings.sent1: The popular programme airs every evening and has a large audience.
meanings.sent2: She enjoys watching comedy programmes with her family on weekends.
meanings.sent3: The programme about animals had everyone laughing at the funny antics.
meanings.sent4: His life felt like a dramatic programme, with unexpected twists and turns.
meanings.sent5: The radio programme featured interviews with famous musicians and artists.
